result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle Serwatka was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent, with credit for 1 days served.
Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 pm on 9/16/22.

miscConds.notes:
- Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment. Any cash bail on deposit to apply and the remaining balance to be returned to the poster.
- DV assessment imposed, as to count 3.
- Court set restitution at zero.
- No contact with D.L. unless approved by the court.

- Complete batterer's intervention program or a course in anger management.
- Provide a DNA sample.

- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent, with credit for 1 days served.

miscConds.notes:
- No contact with firearms.
*Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle Serwatka

records.addlTxt: Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $590.0 entered as ordered by the court on 10/14/22 to pay $50.00 monthly.  Final payment due by 10/16/2023. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.
Affidavit and order for payment of attorney fees and costs due from Milwaukee County signed.  Filed by:    JOHN KREJCI  $590.00
of attorney fees and costs due from Milwaukee County, signed and filed.

Defendant Kyle Serwatka in court.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court for Kyle Serwatka.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a jury trial. Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Counts 2 and 4 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 3: Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  
Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 1: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent, with credit for 1 days served. 

AS TO COUNT 3: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, concurrent, with credit for 1 days served. 

Court STAYED the sentences and placed the defendant on probation for 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Complete batterer's intervention program or a course in anger management.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- No contact with D.L. unless approved by the court.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- DV assessment imposed, as to count 3.
- Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment. Any cash bail on deposit to apply and the remaining balance to be returned to the poster.
- Court set restitution at zero.

*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 
*Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
*Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 pm on 9/16/22.

Received and filed: Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief; Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.

OFF THE RECORD- Defendant Kyle Serwatka appeared by video.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci appeared by video for Kyle Serwatka.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Final pre-trial held. Case remains in trial posture. Case remains calendared for a jury trial on 09/14/2022 at 8:30 am in Branch 29.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8-29-22
State's Motions in Limine, received and filed.
State's Witness List, received and filed.

Case set for a scheduling conference on 7/29/22 at 8:30 am. Court is down and unable to hear the matter. Defense counsel requests a final pre-trial and jury trial. Final pre-trial set for 8/30/22 at 8:30 am. Jury trial set for 9/14/22 at 8:30 am. Parties notified via email.

Defendant Kyle Serwatka in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pre-trial conference held.  Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. John Krejci, present in court, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning at the completion of the case, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. The victim requests the no contact order be modified. Statement made by K.K. State objects. Court DENIES the request. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with KK (12/23/77); DL (6/2/68)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.   ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

ADDRESS INFO for Kyle Serwatka
Current: 4900 S 59th St, Milwaukee, WI 53220 United States  (Effective: 05-31-2022)
Prior: 5452 South Nicholson Avenue, Cudahy, WI 53110

Defendant Kyle Serwatka in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Kyle Serwatka in custody.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kyle Serwatka appeared by video means with Attorney.  Case retabbed to DV intake judge of the week.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT.  This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
